forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 44. South wind 7 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 56. South southwest wind 12 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the city sleeps, a steady rain begins to weave through the streets of Downtown San Francisco, veiling the night in a glistening sheen. The air is imbued with that fresh, earthy scent, a true harbinger of spring’s promise, as temperatures dip gently to the mid-forties. Gusts from the south carry whispers of the coastal fog, though tonight, it remains shy, leaving the sky mostly cloudy but not completely obscured. The rain, relentless yet soothing, will continue through Friday, drenching the city with a promise of rejuvenation—a much-needed quenching by the thirsty earth.

As dawn approaches tomorrow, expect the clouds to cling stubbornly overhead, offering only glimpses of the sun’s warmth. With high temperatures barely scraping fifty-six degrees, dressing warmly will be essential. A cozy sweater layered beneath a waterproof jacket will suffice for a brisk jaunt to the local café, or perhaps to stroll through the nearby parks, where droplets will cling to budding leaves. While the weather may seem dreary to some, those who venture out can bask in the quiet charm that only rain can bring—a chance to watch the city glimmer and reflect, sip hot drinks, and perhaps indulge in the simple pleasure of curling up with a book in a favorite nook.
